items.title: 'We urge everyone to remain peaceful': Protests erupt in Minneapolis after second US citizen shot dead
items.description: This is the second fatal shooting involving federal agents this month during a surge in immigration enforcement in the northern US city.

items.title: Police confirm possible sighting of suspected gunman Julian Ingram
items.description: A large-scale search is underway in the Mount Hope district after a possible sighting of the alleged triple murderer overnight.

items.title: Dingoes involved in death of Canadian backpacker euthanased
items.description: Queensland government officials euthanase six dingoes involved in the death of a Canadian backpacker on K'gari, with more to be put down in the coming days.

items.title: Liberals wait on Hastie-Taylor decision before moving on Ley
items.description: Liberal leadership aspirants Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor are being urged to "sort out" which of them will challenge Sussan Ley for the party's top job before a spill is called.

items.title: Bull shark tagging, extra drones for NSW beaches after attacks
items.description: NSW coast and Sydney Harbour beach goers can expect to see more drones in the sky after a $4.2 million investment into the state's shark management program in the wake of four shark attacks, including one fatal.

items.title: Fire threatens homes in Victoria's Otways ahead of possible record heat
items.description: An out-of-control bushfire continues to threaten communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

items.title: Some accept the risk of shark bites. Others quietly wrestle with fear
items.description: As a devoted ocean swimmer, I've learned to accept the risk of exploring an ocean that is not my natural habitat.

items.title: American rock climber reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
items.description: It took Alex Honnold about 90 minutes to reach the top of the 508-metre-tall building.

items.title: Meet the 2026 Australian of the Year nominees
items.description: Life-saving underwater amputations, decades of healthcare in refugee camps and fundraising campaigns for Australia's first astronaut – these are just a few of the achievements of the 2026 crop of Australian of the Year nominees.

items.title: Live: Alcaraz leads tight encounter as Sabalenka storms into Aus Open last eight
items.description: Carlos Alcaraz is on track to advance at the Australian Open after Aryna Sabalenka moved through to the last eight in Melbourne. Follow live.

items.title: Last-ditch push to land hospitals deal as states fight back
items.description: The Commonwealth will try to force a deal on hospital funding at a National Cabinet meeting this week, after months of stalled negotiations with angry state leaders, who say the federal government is not contributing its fair share.

items.title: Trump praises UK troops as 'brave' warriors, day after 'front line' slur
items.description: The US President has praised British soldiers, after remarks he made earlier this week about NATO troops in Afghanistan were described as "insulting and appalling" by the UK's Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

items.title: US snowstorm triggers flight cancellations and power outages
items.description: A monster snowstorm is moving across the US, cancelling thousands of flights, knocking out power and snarling major roadways with ice.

items.title: Prince Harry sues the Daily Mail, but in the court of public opinion, he is on trial
items.description: This week, Prince Harry traded the sunny West Coast for London to give evidence in a "super claim" against the publishers of the Daily Mail and the Mail on Sunday, Associated Newspapers.

items.title: PM appoints Defence Department secretary as next ambassador to US
items.description: Defence department boss Greg Moriarty is named the next ambassador to the United States, as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticises the US president's claim that allied troops did not serve on the front lines of Afghanistan.

items.title: Chinese general seen as closest military ally to Xi Jinping falls to purge
items.description: Rumours of a probe swirled last week after military officials Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli appeared to miss a meeting chaired by Xi Jinping.

items.title: Next generation players usher in new era in Australian cricket
items.description: While Australian punters and pundits alike have been wringing their hands over an aging national cricket squad, the next generation has been quietly getting to work, proving they are ready to fill the shoes of retiring stars.

items.title: 'I was sucked in': Dual citizen's warning over middleman passport websites
items.description: As many British-Australian dual nationals grapple with new entry requirements, experts warn of exploitative and middleman websites.

items.title: Troy Cassar-Daley brings the story of a great Wiradjuri warrior back home
items.description: Country music star Troy Cassar-Daley didn't know anything about First Nations warrior Windradyne. But once he learned more, he was determined to sing his story home.

items.title: Australia's most popular baby names from 2025 revealed
items.description: Abbey wanted a traditional, feminine name for her newborn daughter that would convey strength. Unwittingly, she chose one of the most popular baby names in Australia from 2025.

items.title: Nine youths hospitalised for self-harm in new NT detention centre's first year
items.description: Nine youths ended up in hospital after self-harming at Darwin's new $130 million detention centre in the 12 months after it opened, documents released to the ABC under Freedom of Information laws have revealed.

items.title: The 'disgust and hostility' that fuelled Shinzo Abe's assassin
items.description: The man who killed former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe thought it was his life's mission to destroy a controversial church.

items.title: How the great Australian home ownership dream is aging
items.description: The average age of purchasing your first home is increasing as economists say politicians continue to favour the current home owner.

items.title: Hottest 100 of 2025 - featuring Playlunch, Olivia Dean, Tame Impala and RAYE
items.description: It's that time again, triple j has counted down the year's Hottest 100 songs as voted by the public, celebrating all the incredible music that soundtracked our lives in 2025.

items.title: Chinese travellers once flocked to Australia. Then came the pandemic
items.description: Chinese visitor numbers have increased but are still below pre-pandemic levels, with economists warning ongoing economic uncertainty in China could dampen long-haul travel.
